Currently, the following three plugins depend on eclipse ui plugins:
org.eclipse.cosmos.rm.repository
org.eclipse.cosmos.rm.smlif
org.eclipse.cosmos.rm.validation

These plugins need to be run outside eclipse, and should not depend on eclipse UI code.  Removing the UI dependencies will greatly help reduce the footprint of the SML MDR.

SML-IF and Validation plug-ins have UI code in them.  The SML-IF plug-in contains an editor and UI-based import/export utilities.  We could possibly refactor the validation plug-in so that the menu extensions are part of the SML-IF plug-in, but we will need at least one plug-in to have Eclipse UI dependencies.

Hubert, what functions from these three plugins you need to run outside of the Eclipse framework ?
For example, the smlif plugin contains the IF editor which is by definition an Eclipse based functionality. We need to understand your requirements before refactoring the code
I was mistaken in the bug description.  I don't need to run smlif outside eclipse.  I only need to run the repository plugin outside eclipse, which depends on the validation plugin.

Yes, I think the problem is that the repository plug-in prereqs the validation plug-in, which in turn prereqs the SMLIF plug-in.  I think it's correct that we need to make it so the repository plug-in does not prereq any plug-ins that depend on UI code, hence the need for some refactoring.

David volunteered to take over this defect.
